blog.name: lodessa
blog.title: Not a Smut Queen... A Smut Khaleesi
blog.description:
I appear to have tumbled back down into Game of Thrones/A Song of Ice and Fire Fandom again (Jaime/Brienne, Dany/Jorah, Jon/Sansa, amongst other pairings). I'm still living that Star Trek Fan Life (mostly Voyager [Janeway/Chakotay OTP) and Discovery (Admiral Katrina Cornwell and Captain Philippa Georgiou focus). I cannot possibly list everything I might reblog, but forever carrying a torch for Veronica Mars (I live a Weevil appreciation life), Miss Fisher's Murder Mysteries, Doctor Who (Nine, Martha Jones), Roslin/Adama, Buffy/Faith, Aral/Cordelia, amongst others.


Testimonial by wakeupgreat:

"lodessa is an amazing human! she can be recognized in the wild by her inara icon and is known across the land for star trek rpf and for being into a song of ice and fire long before it was a tv show. she is a fellow fandom oldie and we relate on many levels. also once she wrote me cersei/brienne so basically she is the BEST."

summary: Do you think Brienne will find Sansa in the books? What about Arya?
question: Do you think Brienne will find Sansa in the books? What about Arya?
answer: It’s like that Brienne will find Sansa and Arya will find them both. Sansa is on the same continent and if she does go North early in TWoW, Brienne will hear about it eventually. Maybe the war against the Boltons happens similar-ish to the show but Arya is the calvary instead of the Knights of the Vale. It’s possible that Brienne finds Arya first if Arya escapes the Faceless men early in TWoW and then they both go North together with the Brotherhood (after Lady Stoneheart dies) and Nymeria and her wolf pack.

It’s possible that Brienne finds Arya first if Arya escapes the Faceless men early in TWoW and then they both go North together with the Brotherhood (after Lady Stoneheart dies) and Nymeria and her wolf pack.

It’s possible that Brienne finds Arya first if Arya escapes the Faceless men early in TWoW and then they both go North together with the Brotherhood (after Lady Stoneheart dies) and Nymeria and her wolf pack.

summary: I like how Bran was already looking at Sansa when the camera panned over to them at the dragon pit when everyone was Ayeing him...
body: I like how Bran was already looking at Sansa when the camera panned over to them at the dragon pit when everyone was Ayeing him as king. He knew what was probably on Sansa’s mind since she had been fighting for the North for so long, so he was curious about what she was going to say.

reblog.comment: I like how Bran was already looking at Sansa when the camera panned over to them at the dragon pit when everyone was Ayeing him as king. He knew what was probably on Sansa’s mind since she had been fighting for the North for so long, so he was curious about what she was going to say.

He knew what was probably on Sansa’s mind since she had been fighting for the North for so long, so he was curious about what she was going to say.

summary: 'Sweet child, this is Lord Petyr Baelish, of the king’s small council. “Your mother was my queen of beauty once,” the man said...
body: ‘Sweet child, this is Lord Petyr Baelish, of the king’s small council. “Your mother was my queen of beauty once,” the man said quietly. His breath smelled of mint. “You have her hair.” His fingers brushed against her cheek as he stroked one auburn lock. Quite abruptly he turned and walked away.’

reblog.comment: ‘Sweet child, this is Lord Petyr Baelish, of the king’s small council. “Your mother was my queen of beauty once,” the man said quietly. His breath smelled of mint. “You have her hair.” His fingers brushed against her cheek as he stroked one auburn lock. Quite abruptly he turned and walked away.’

summary: I absolutely loved Arya killing the night king but I feel like it would have been cooler if it had been him and Jon fighting one...
body: I absolutely loved Arya killing the night king but I feel like it would have been cooler if it had been him and Jon fighting one on one and just as the night king is about to kill Bran and Jon Arya swoops in and they kill him together but not before he manages to hit her with a fatal blow and the entire army collapses as she and the night king do and then they cut to Daenerys holding Jorah and crying to Jon holding Arya crying and Sansa, Gendry, Davos, Tormund, the hound, and Brienne make it over there to find Jon and Bran and celebrate and they see Jon holding her body and crying with bran watching and they start to mourn her and just when they think all hope is lost Melissandre walks in and bran looks at her and says “what do we say to the god of death?” then she kneels over Arya and puts her hand on her and says “not today” and then the episode ends with Arya suddenly taking a sharp breath in and opening her eyes then it cuts to black, I don’t know I feel like that would have been cooler but maybe that’s just me

summary: it was only a word, it was almost misheard (i wasn't expecting that) - notalone91 - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
title: it was only a word, it was almost misheard (i wasn't expecting that) - notalone91 - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Chapter 6: listen to my heart can you hear it sing (telling me to give you everything) 

The Many-Faced God is as fair as possible when it comes to love. On a person’s twenty-first Nameday, their soulmate is bound to them by a mark on their body with the first sentence they’ll ever speak to their love. There’s no rhyme or reason. If it were, everyone would have a match; everyone’s soulmate would make sense.

When Tyrion Lannister gets his mark and realizes that the person is to marry his nephew, he is resigned to the fact that love is not in the cards for him. Or is it?

Is fluff without plot a thing? Because this chapter did NOTHING for the plot but was literally all about the conversation and the growing together (and serving my desire for a chapter that was just… nice, fluffy happy goodness before what the next plot point that happens is.) There’s going to be a slight slow-down of the posting for the next couple of chapters while I try to finish up the story. As usual, my leaning for the most purple of prose is making things take longer than I expect, but hopefully, the fact that this chapter is something like 11k words should make up for that?

blog.name: saint-hatice
blog.title: Hatice
blog.description:
Will man this Trash Dinghy Solo if need be 
strike hard and true, crow (or i'll come back and haunt you) 
 a red swollen plum in my mouth (a milkweed full of blood)
 trash > cannon

tags: fic: strike hard and true crow (or i'll come back and haunt you)
i would love it if you guys read by bad wrong jonsa fic
summary: fic: strike hard and true, crow (or i’ll come back and haunt you)
title: fic: strike hard and true, crow (or i’ll come back and haunt you)
body:
Death has come to bend the knee.

chapter seven

The promise of a Lannister was sure as war, mercenarial.

But the promise of a Stark was like the promise of Winter, gold and men and death stepped aside for it, and it came sweeping over the world, absolute.

She rode back with him to Castle Black, he had not trusted her to sit in front of him, had not trusted the sweet scent of her hair. But she wound her arms around him, holding tight as though they were riding through a storm and not the last, rare and sun-drowned day of the year.

Her palm, his heart.

His dead heart, her Stark promise.

And Jon Snow, dead between them

chapter one - chapter seven

Conventional wisdom is coming to Westeros (and Essos).
We size up who's up, who's down, and who's treading water.

blog.name: acourtofhopeanddreams
blog.title: Enjoy the little things!
blog.description:
Open your heart
To the love of the world
It only needs one person
Touching it with 
A word
A look
A smile
A kiss

title: So in Love - Chapter 6
body:
Written based on a “what if” I talked about in one of my canon compliance pieces for Theonsa

Chapter 1 // Chapter 2 // Chapter 3 // Chapter 4 // Chapter 5

The royal family is on its way to Winterfell and Sansa can’t stop talking about prince Joffrey. Normally Theon likes being in her company, but this time he just wants this visit to be over. Because the sooner prince Joffrey is gone again, the sooner Sansa will realise that her true love and handsome knight has always be there.

*This will probably be Theon dreaming about marrying Sansa for a long time, but I promise, he will get noticed at some point!*

Theon turned from one side to the other. He had no idea how long he laid awake yet, but every time he walked to the window and looked outside it was still dark.

At Bran’s window the dire wolves from the Starks were howling. Servants of the royal family demanded more than once that someone had to make them shut up. But the wolves didn’t listen.

They didn’t listen when Robb tried to soothe them and tell them that people wanted to sleep. They didn’t listen when Arya tried being angry with them and it seemed that now it was Sansa’s turn to try.

She wore a coat over her nightgown and the big black boots of her older brother to keep her feet warm. Her steps looked slightly unbalanced and yet Theon couldn’t fight the grin spreading across his face. Even barely awake and dressed in clothes that didn’t really fit a future Queen, she still looked pretty and beautiful and elegant. And she most of all still managed to make his heart beat faster.

He had been the one giving her her dire wolf. Actually Robb had wanted to do it, but there were two more pups and so Theon had volunteered to give Sansa one of the females.

The wolf in his arms had tried to bite him multiple times, but her teeth hadn’t been sharp enough yet to do much damage. She had easily been the prettiest of the nest and all the way towards the garden, where Sansa had been making flower crowns with Jeyne Poole, he had stared at the beautiful beast.

“Sansa?” Theon had tried to shield the pup from her curious eyes, but had failed hopelessly. Even though the dog had only been a puppy then, she had already been quite big, too big to hide behind his back. “I’ve got something for you.” He had smiled and had waited for Sansa to stand up.

The white flowers in her red hair had been mesmerising, but her eyes had been fixated on the bundle of fur in his arms while she walked towards him. “What’s this?”

“A dire wolf.” He had carefully placed the wolf in Sansa’s arms. “We found them in the woods. A nest of five.” He had not told Sansa about the white wolf with the red eyes and he had also not told her that he had been all too eager to kill them when her father had given that order. Even though the pup in his arms had looked harmless in a way, the wolves had scared him. “This one’s yours.”

They still scared him sometimes.

They scared him now.

“Lady…” Sansa kneeled down next to her wolf.

The wolf was no longer a pup. She had grown bigger and bigger and she was now already the size of an average human dog. And she hadn’t stopped growing yet. She would grow even bigger and one day she would maybe be just as tall as Sansa herself.

Sansa’s hands caressed her wolf’s fur. In the moonlight her skin looked even paler than normally and her loose hair covered her face now she leaned forward. “Bran needs rest. We all do. You have to tell the others to keep quiet.”

But the wolf didn’t listen. Not even to her. They only seemed to do so when they truly felt their lives depended on it.

“Lady!” Sansa had yelled, her hands next to her mouth to make her scream go even further. “Lady! Come back!”

Teaching the wolves to listen and behave had been a lot harder than Robb and Bran had probably thought it would be. These weren’t dogs they could easily tame. These were wild animals, born in freedom and now raised in captivity.

“Lady!” Sansa had stamped her feet and had crossed her arms over her chest. “If father finds out about this, he might have you killed.”

“I won’t let that happen, Sansa.” Theon’s reply had surprised even himself. “I promise.”

He normally never questioned Ned Stark’s decisions. He didn’t have the luxury to do so. And yet he knew that if Ned would ever ask him to kill one of the wolves again, he couldn’t do it.

Even though Sansa had been slightly afraid of the wolf at first, she had also grown very attached to it very quickly. Wherever Sansa went, her wolf followed, always keeping an eye on her and stepping in whenever someone came a little too close.

More than once Lady had growled at Theon, had bared her teeth and had warned him to keep his distance.

It was a pity that Ned Stark had ordered his children to keep the dire wolves away from the royal family.

Theon would have loved to see what Lady would have done to Joffrey.

The handsome prince maybe would have lost one of his precious hands. Or, if Theon had been very lucky, the wolf would have gone for a far more delicious piece of meat. And with one bite Lady could have ruined this marriage before it had even happened, much easier and much faster than Theon and Robb could.

A soft chuckle escaped Theon’s slightly parted lips and Sansa looked up, her glance meeting his.

“It’s not funny!” She shook her head and quickly Theon stepped back and returned to his comfortable bed.

In a way the howling of the wolves, even though it was deafening, had something reassuring too. They were howling because one of them was hurt and fighting for his life. The Starks were just as much part of the pack as the wolves were.

And if there was one thing Theon knew about packs, it was that they always looked after one another.

When his head rested on his pillow again he closed his eyes. He heard Sansa attempting to calm the wolves down once more and failing again.

Maybe they would have more luck if they would send little Rickon. But Rickon was without a doubt fest asleep, not understanding a bit of what was actually going on.

But Theon wasn’t that blissfully ignorant anymore. And deep down he knew that it had never been the howling of the wolves keeping him awake.

*This will probably be Theon dreaming about marrying Sansa for a long time, but I promise, he will get noticed at some point!*

At Bran’s window the dire wolves from the Starks were howling. Servants of the royal family demanded more than once that someone had to make them shut up. But the wolves didn’t listen.

They didn’t listen when Robb tried to soothe them and tell them that people wanted to sleep. They didn’t listen when Arya tried being angry with them and it seemed that now it was Sansa’s turn to try.

She wore a coat over her nightgown and the big black boots of her older brother to keep her feet warm. [[MORE]]

The white flowers in her red hair had been mesmerising, but her eyes had been fixated on the bundle of fur in his arms while she walked towards him. “What’s this?”

“A dire wolf.” He had carefully placed the wolf in Sansa’s arms. “We found them in the woods. A nest of five.” He had not told Sansa about the white wolf with the red eyes and he had also not told her that he had been all too eager to kill them when her father had given that order. Even though the pup in his arms had looked harmless in a way, the wolves had scared him. “This one’s yours.”

“Lady…” Sansa kneeled down next to her wolf.

Sansa’s hands caressed her wolf’s fur. In the moonlight her skin looked even paler than normally and her loose hair covered her face now she leaned forward. “Bran needs rest. We all do. You have to tell the others to keep quiet.”

But the wolf didn’t listen. Not even to her. They only seemed to do so when they truly felt their lives depended on it.

“Lady!” Sansa had yelled, her hands next to her mouth to make her scream go even further. “Lady! Come back!”

Teaching the wolves to listen and behave had been a lot harder than Robb and Bran had probably thought it would be. These weren’t dogs they could easily tame. These were wild animals, born in freedom and now raised in captivity.

“Lady!” Sansa had stamped her feet and had crossed her arms over her chest. “If father finds out about this, he might have you killed.”

Even though Sansa had been slightly afraid of the wolf at first, she had also grown very attached to it very quickly. Wherever Sansa went, her wolf followed, always keeping an eye on her and stepping in whenever someone came a little too close.

More than once Lady had growled at Theon, had bared her teeth and had warned him to keep his distance.

It was a pity that Ned Stark had ordered his children to keep the dire wolves away from the royal family.

Theon would have loved to see what Lady would have done to Joffrey.

The handsome prince maybe would have lost one of his precious hands. Or, if Theon had been very lucky, the wolf would have gone for a far more delicious piece of meat. And with one bite Lady could have ruined this marriage before it had even happened, much easier and much faster than Theon and Robb could.

But Theon wasn’t that blissfully ignorant anymore. And deep down he knew that it had never been the howling of the wolves keeping him awake.

Chapter 1 // Chapter 2 // Chapter 3 // Chapter 4 // Chapter 5

The royal family is on its way to Winterfell and Sansa can’t stop talking about prince Joffrey. Normally Theon likes being in her company, but this time he just wants this visit to be over. Because the sooner prince Joffrey is gone again, the sooner Sansa will realise that her true love and handsome knight has always be there.

*This will probably be Theon dreaming about marrying Sansa for a long time, but I promise, he will get noticed at some point!*

Theon turned from one side to the other. He had no idea how long he laid awake yet, but every time he walked to the window and looked outside it was still dark.

At Bran’s window the dire wolves from the Starks were howling. Servants of the royal family demanded more than once that someone had to make them shut up. But the wolves didn’t listen.

They didn’t listen when Robb tried to soothe them and tell them that people wanted to sleep. They didn’t listen when Arya tried being angry with them and it seemed that now it was Sansa’s turn to try.

She wore a coat over her nightgown and the big black boots of her older brother to keep her feet warm. Her steps looked slightly unbalanced and yet Theon couldn’t fight the grin spreading across his face. Even barely awake and dressed in clothes that didn’t really fit a future Queen, she still looked pretty and beautiful and elegant. And she most of all still managed to make his heart beat faster.

He had been the one giving her her dire wolf. Actually Robb had wanted to do it, but there were two more pups and so Theon had volunteered to give Sansa one of the females.

The wolf in his arms had tried to bite him multiple times, but her teeth hadn’t been sharp enough yet to do much damage. She had easily been the prettiest of the nest and all the way towards the garden, where Sansa had been making flower crowns with Jeyne Poole, he had stared at the beautiful beast.

“Sansa?” Theon had tried to shield the pup from her curious eyes, but had failed hopelessly. Even though the dog had only been a puppy then, she had already been quite big, too big to hide behind his back. “I’ve got something for you.” He had smiled and had waited for Sansa to stand up.

blog.name: kickingroses
blog.title: Abandon All Sanity
blog.description:
My name is Rose. 
Enjoy whatever media I'm currently hyped over. #IStandWithDaenerys

summary: Rewatching GOT season 1 and if you had told me eight years ago that this cute little Bran was going to end up being King, I...
body:
Rewatching GOT season 1 and if you had told me eight years ago that this cute little Bran was going to end up being King, I would have been all for it! There was a point where I loved so many of these characters and were happy with how they were going that I would have been cool with any of them being King or Queen at the end.

Except Bran, this Bran we see at the start and who goes on his quest, is not the Bran who wins the throne. As Meera says, he dies in the cave with Summer and Hodor. An emotionless creature takes over his body and allows a city to burn to take control of the realm.

And Sansa - I don’t say much on Sansa and I suppose, being a Dany stan, people think I hate her. Far from it. I’ve adored watching Sansa grow and I wanted to see her be the one to bring down Cersei more so than Dany because Sansa had a history and relationship with Cersei that Dany didn’t. I wanted her to be the Queen ‘younger and prettier’ who takes the throne from Cersei LIKE THE SEVEN FACED GOD DAMN PROPHECY. I was cheering Sansa and Arya on when they fooled Littlefinger and when she fed Ramsey to his hounds. 

So why aren’t I happy that Sansa gets to be Queen of the North, which is actually just as large as the other kingdoms combined? Because, just like Bran’s rise to the throne and Dany’s fall to madness, it doesn’t feel earned. And that’s not to say we haven’t seen glimpses of Sansa being a good ruler and caring for her people - we have - but they were glimpses, always in the background, mostly used to points of arguments between her and Dany or her and Jon. Compare the three “King/Queen in the North!” scenes. For Robb and Jon, they were chosen by their people. They made no claim or push for royalty or independence - the North loved them and chose them. But with Sansa it felt like…she was basically Queen by default as there were no males left to content with her. We don’t see a single recognisable face at her coronation! We don’t see anyone CHOOSING her as the Queen apart from herself and her own brother (if he’s even still that) giving her the okay about it. Even the knight sworn to protect her has left her side! We don’t really see Sansa do anything this season that really showed her lessons and growth be for anything heroic - aside from giving the North independence. She’s mainly there as a rival for Dany, then not doing anything in the crypt - even at the Battle of Blackwater she was trying to keep everyones spirits up! - and then becoming an Oathbreaker and all her family leaving her again.

Tl;dr - Bran deserved better. Sansa deserved better. We deserved better.
